title.narrative: F.a: Continuation of Adivasi Traditional Rights and Livelihood Programme implemented in 40 villages of Sudra and Urladani

description.narrative: The people of the area are not aware of their basic rights, Govt. Schemes + facilities and hence do not avail them. The literacy rate is very low in the area. Several factors including economic, family attitudes, social practices, traditional knowledge and behaviours limit the access and participation of common person in developmental process. Poor families are often cited, as being ?not interested in programmes?, but this is most often a reflection of the lack of quality and delivery of services that is tr ansparent, accessible and relevant for community. The absence of collaborative and informative processes in the initial years is a significant contributing factor to increased participation in the poverty reduction programme. Major issues of governance tha t have affected the performance of the social sector in antipoverty programmes include lack of motivation of the key implementers, poor monitoring, the lack of transparency with regard to the micro level planning. Public management and delivery systems req uire strengthening, particularly in disadvantaged areas. Elected Representatives of Panchayat, women collectives and local CBOs have to play crucial roles in implementation of national flagship programmes addressing poverty reduction including FRA and NREG A. That is, to translate schemes into actions and benefits for the social excluded population
